meanings.definition: A collection of items gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The congeries of toys in the playroom made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: She organized the congeries of books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent3: The congeries of mismatched socks seemed to have a party in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The congeries of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The congeries of colorful balloons filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: A mass or heap of various things.
meanings.sent1: The congeries of leaves piled up in the yard after the storm.
meanings.sent2: He sifted through the congeries of papers on his desk to find the important one.
meanings.sent3: The congeries of candies spilled out of the jar and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The congeries of thoughts in her mind felt overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The congeries of seashells on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.
